intro: Micronychia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
